oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Frances W. Preston Remembers John Lennon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Frances W. Preston remembering John Lennon. The interview takes place on 12/09/1980, the day after John Lennon's death.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Frances W. Preston, John Lennon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:19) -- Frances W. Preston describes how she first met John Lennon. The two met at the 1972 BMI Awards Dinner. (1:05) -- Frances Preston describes John Lennon's interest in Sam Phillips and Sun Records. (2:03) -- Frances Preston describes John Lennon's interest in other songwriters. (4:11) -- Frances Preston describes John Lennon as "One of the warmest people on that occasion that I had an opportunity to meet." (6:04) -- "He would talk with anybody, there were no bodyguards, there was no security, there was no shying away from people, he participated in the evening" - Frances Preston about John Lennon. (7:04) -- John Lomax asks Frances Preston about his post-Beatles work. (8:19) -- Frances Preston discusses the signing of The Beatles to BMI. Frances Preston discusses Bob Burton's excitement about The Beatles before their fame. (9:27) -- John Lomax asks Frances Preston about the effect of John Lennon's death on artists. (13:21) -- "I think John Lennon was blessed with the joy of music and love of people" - Frances Preston. (13:34) -- Frances Preston describes a personal story between her and King Curtis showing her Harlem. (14:16) -- John Lomax asks Frances Preston about John Lennon's signature songwriting. (16:42) -- Frances Preston describes John Lennon as a "songwriting giant," along with Irving Berlin, George Gershwin. (21:26) -- John Lomax and Frances Preston discuss the impact of an artist's death of their record sales.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Preston, Frances Williams, 1928-2012 ;Lennon, John;
